thread.title: The 11 most common Results Day clichés
thread.title_full: The 11 most common Results Day clichés - Telegraph

author: Samuel Lovett
title: The 11 most common Results Day clichés
text: Despite the uncertainty of the big day itself, students can always rely on the same old clichés making an appearance on A-level Results Day. Here are 11 of the most common you can expect to see – and attempt to avoid – on the lead up to August 13: 1. Tweets that lose all perspective on life 1 week til the end of the world i.e. results day — Eleanor (@walkingtrxvasty) August 6, 2015 Thursday will be the death of me #resultsday — ?ay-you (@SayuuAmirali) August 8, 2015 2. Alternatively, nonchalant tweets that don’t seem at all phased by the big day I literally don't even care anymore like I'm not bothered #resultsday — a (@lovatoszac) August 2, 2015 ...while others are excitedly counting down the days. Feel like I'm the only person kind of looking forward to #ResultsDay — Paulo Dybala (@tomafs17) July 25, 2015 3. The underlying worry that Ucas Track will crash Patience is a virtue... Photo: Alamy 4. Twitter accounts dedicated to Results Day will get the feelings of the nation's students spot on #ThingsMoreLikelyThanMePassingMyExams The DFS Sale ending — A Level Problems (@ALevelProblems) August 7, 2015 How sad that this milk has the same expiry date as me pic.twitter.com/zsUZJOawph — A Level Problems (@ALevelProblems) August 7, 2015 5. At least one member of the family will remark that exams were harder back in their day, when their C in maths would now be an A* A-levels were once as hard as PhDs... honestly Photo: Time & Life Pictures/Getty Image 6. Another relative, usually a wise-cracking uncle, will comment that the University of Life is a much better education than O-levels 7. Painfully staged photos of students either... a) holding their results above their head Yay, we've got our results Photo: Dominic Lipinski/PA b) going through their results together as a group (something which no student would be willing to do) Ha! I did better in English! Photo: Christopher Pledger/The Telegraph c) jumping for pure, unadulterated joy We are jumping to show just how happy we are! Photo: Anna Gowthorpe/PA 8. Game of Thrones style memes - because what situation isn't improved with GoT? One week until #ResultsDay pic.twitter.com/M21TRbStbF — Vita Student (@vitastudent) August 6, 2015 9. Parents will post embarassing congratulatory messages on Facebook, saying they always knew you were destined for great things... You always were a high achiever Photo: Geoff Robinson 9. Whatever the results, politicans will demand another massive overhaul of the education system Gove is gone... but calls for change will continue Photo: PA 10. The students themselves. From the Nosy Parker to the Humble Bragger, every student caricature will be out in full colours on the big day Results Day? I had no idea it was tomorrow *ticks another day off calendar* Photo: Blend Images / Alamy 11. Whatever the outcome of the results, you can be sure thousands of students will be jetting off to Malia or Zante that very same day PARTAY!
